overview:
Dr. Trebley brings a broad range of experience to In-vivo Ventures. While completing his doctoral degree in pharmacology at Purdue University, Dr. Trebley performed extensive research relation to the effects of oncogenes on breast cancer treatment and prevention.

Dr. Trebley is currently serving as the Director of Technology Development for Kylin Therapeutics, an In-vivo portfolio company. In addition to his expertise in cancer research, Dr. Trebley brings valuable licensing and business development experience to the In-vivo team. While working at the Purdue Research Foundation, he was involved in a number of successful medical device and biotech start-up companies including Nanovis Inc., Comentis Inc., Paxvax Inc., Moerae Matrix Inc., and Andara Life Sciences, Inc. In support of these companies, Dr. Trebley provided a number of services including intellectual property and regulatory approval strategies, licensing, and business development.

Dr. Trebley has an A.B. in Chemistry from Wabash College and a Ph.D. from the Purdue University School of Pharmacy.
